text: Did the way github access "secrets" change? It looks like they are now under "actions secrets"
and I don't think I'm able to access them in the same way

Hi, I'm trying to use the `hs filemanager fetch --account=<name> <src> [dest]` command, but it's telling me that the request is forbidden, and "_the oauth-token (XXXX) does not have proper permissions! (requires any of [file-manager=access])_"

Can anyone help me understand what this means and how I can fix it so that I have access? Thanks

Hmm... I just noticed that the permission options (scopes?) are different in the free developer accounts vs the paid accounts. So does this mean that the File Manager isn't accessible on dev accounts using the command line tools?
